newsletters.intro:
Welcome to Peblio's first ever newsletter! Firstly - thank you for using Peblio and hope you will enjoy our newsletter as well.
Here's what we have for you this week:
Why did we build Peblio
Featured curricula!
New features
Our upcoming talk at CCFest, San Francisco

articles.heading: 1. Why did we build Peblio
articles.para: We launched Peblio last year as a way to make it easy for teachers to write about code and share lessons and worksheets. The founders of Peblio are teachers, designers and educators, and designed Peblio with the help of our fellow teachers. We value your feedback and take feature requests very seriously so please take a minute to tell us how it's going!

articles.heading: 2. Featured Curriculum
articles.para:
Every newsletter we are going to be sharing some curriculum that we think you would be interested in! So do reach out and share with us
Here is this weeks curriculum - 'The Physics of Video Games' - by STEMCoding.

articles.heading: 3. New features
articles.para: One of the most awaited featured we made live is the full screen mode. We know you'd like to see all of your code when you're working, so here it is! You can also view only the output when you're in fullscreen mode if you'd like to show it off.

articles.heading: 4. Our upcoming talk at CCFest, San Francisco
articles.para: We are giving a Workshop  at CC Fest in San Francisco on October 19th on building meme generators in p5 and explaining how you can use Peblio in classrooms.
articles.linkText: Do visit us at the CC Fest in SF!

articles.heading: 1. Featured Curriculum
articles.para: Want to learn more p5.js - check out the content created by CS4All. This curriculum covers everything from small tutorials like flappy bird to full semester content for Interactive Computational Media (ICM) classes. They also have content for teacher training for the same topics as well

articles.heading: 2. Profiles in Peblio
articles.para: Building a Profile is a great way to showcase your craft. At Peblio, we always wanted to empower people from different communities to be able to do share their work. Peblio makes it easy for you to share your work with your colleagues, friends and family. If you have a non student account - you can access your profile under the account options.

articles.heading: 3. CCfest - SF and LA!
articles.para: Being around the student - teacher community is always energizing. We had an amazing time teaching students and teachers how to create memes with p5 using peblio last Saturday in SF! We’re going to be doing the same in LA this Saturday - so be sure to join us for our workshop - “Learning Arrays through meme generators
articles.linkText: Click here to join us in LA

articles.heading: 4. Featured Creator: Mathura
articles.para: This week we want to introduce you to one of our creators who is part of the Peblio team. In addition to being Peblio's lead developer, Mathura is a creative technologist and educator. Her work involves a lot of creative coding, LEDs and occasionally maps.
